DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluating BENEFIX in Previously Treated Patients With Hemophilia B
DOC.detailed_description: Phase IV, open-label, non comparative, multicenter, previously treated patients (PTP) clinical trial. Patients with severe or moderate hemophilia B with baseline levels of plasma factor IX < 5% activity will participate in this study for both treatment regimens: "on demand" therapy for acute bleeding episodes and therapy for prophylaxis of bleeding episodes ( "Short-term therapy")*. * Short-Term Therapy: Prophylactic therapy given before surgery, including dental procedures, prior to a event that would likely result in bleeding ( sports, exercise, or heavy work), as well as to prevent further bleeds into a target joint). This short-term therapy for intermittent secondary therapy.
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients with moderate to severe hemophilia B ( < 5% circulating factor IX activity) having acute hemorrhage or requiring "shortterm therapy" for intermittent secondary prophylaxis regimens. 2. HIV seropositive ( asymptomatic) or seronegative subjects. 3. No history or detectable inhibitors.
